description: Rajan’s mission of inflation targeting and clean-up of banks are accomplished. Unless someone is determined to wreck institution, it is difficult to reverse the direction.
title: Rexit or not, Rajan’s ‘inclusive institution’ can last much longer

description: The Nifty50 moved in a narrow range on Wednesday and closed marginally higher, thus forming a ‘Hanging Man’ pattern on the daily candlestick charts.
title: Tech view: Hanging Man pattern on Nifty50 charts signals pause

description: The shares of payment systems company Ingenico also fell 4.8 percent, impacted by a slump in its rival VeriFone after VeriFone posted lower-than-expected earnings.
title: European shares fall back as drop in Erste knocks bank stocks

description: ETFs are group of securities which are traded like individual stocks on an exchange. They can track equity indices, bonds and commodities among others.
title: Nifty50 based ETF assets surge 7-fold to Rs 8,533 crore

description: Budapest stocks inched to eight-year highs, shrugging off a 15 percent fall in lender FHB Bank which was fined by regulators for alleged market manipulation.
title: EM stocks up at 1-month high on decent Chinese imports

description: Spot gold was up 0.6 percent at $1,250.80 an ounce by 0649 GMT. It hit a high of $1,251.00 earlier in the session, its strongest since May 23.
title: Gold hits 2-week high on hopes Fed will not raise rates soon

description: The only bright spot was defence stocks, which rallied all guns blazing. Here is a wrapup of the major trends across stocks during the session.
title: Mapping the market: Defence-linked stocks go all guns blazing; smallcaps have field day

description: Shares of defence-related stocks rallied up to 11 per cent in Wednesday’s trade after reports showed India was on its way to becoming a member of the Missile Technology Control Regime (MTCR).
title: Defence-related stocks soar as India seals berth at MTCR

description: If the government pushes for the GST bill on day one of the monsoon session, then our markets would definitely have more leg up.
title: If monsoon pans out well, expect rate cut before next RBI policy: Gaurang Shah, Geojit BNP Paribas

description: News of share buyback by two public sector entities, NMDC and MOIL, wherein the two companies announced plans to buy back just over 20 per cent of their paidup capital for over $1 billion, failed to prop up their stocks on Wednesday.
title: Share buyback plan fails to lift NMDC, MOIL

description: Shares of JSW Energy surged 12 per cent on Wednesday after reports suggested that the company might clinch the 860 MW Karnataka SEB power purchase deal.
title: JSW Energy surges as company may clinch Karnataka SEB deal

description: Shares of aviation companies took a beating as crude oil prices continued their upward surge.
title: Aviation stocks slip as oil hits 8-month high

description: If we are getting a seasoned campaigner like Rajan choosing to continue, the sentiment definitely becomes positive
title: Rajan continuing will mean there is no loss in transit or somebody dropping the ball: Arvind Narayanan, DBS Bank

description: Lack of cues at home and from abroad and signs of exhaustion after a 15 per cent runup since the Union Budget made investors to take a more calibrated approach on Dalal Street.
title: Sensex, Nifty50 end with mild gains, PSU bank stocks surge

description: I am extremely bullish on the market. As an economy, we have a long way to go and definitely monsoon will trigger an economic boost, says Veliyath.
title: Monsoon will add momentum to market rally: Porinju Veliyath, Equity Intelligence
